title: Ticket #1524: Port to Mac OS X 10.6
description: Condor doesn't build on Mac OS X 10.6. This is primarily due to the default architecture changing from 32-bit to 64-bit.
remarks:
If folks can convince nmi to install cmake 2.8.2 on said platform I would be more then happy to setup a build, and do all the grunt work.

2010-Jul-26 13:27:34 by jfrey:
Here are the two unresolved issues with the port:

  • Lease-manager tests fail on Mac OS X 10.6
  • Creating libcondorapi.so with gcc fails on Mac OS X 10.6. Creating it with g++ fails on Solaris because the gcc installation on the NMI machine doesn't include libstdc++.so; it just has libstdc++.a.

2010-Jul-29 16:41:00 by jfrey:
Pushed changes to master for 7.5.4. This addresses all known porting issues on Mac OS X 10.6.
